metadata.Title: CVE-2015-7212 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Integer overflow in the mozilla::layers::BufferTextureClient::AllocateForSurface function in Mozilla Firefox before 43.0 and Firefox ESR 38.x before 38.5 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code by triggering a graphics operation that requires a large texture allocation.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-7212` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 43.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 43.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 43.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 43.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:38.5.1+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:38.5.1+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:38.5.1+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:38.5.1+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:38.5.1+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:38.5.1+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:38.5.1+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:38.5.1+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required
